components.name: Introduction
components.description:
Jalebi is a work-in-progress UI component library with features like theming, i18n, and more. For more information, visit github.com/sohzm/jalebi.


No deps, no build, no hassle. Just import the components you need and start using them, for example you can include marquee like this:  <script src='https://jalebi.soham.sh/src/jalebi-marquee.js'></script>


Theme Management

Jalebi includes a powerful theme manager with 50+ themes available out of the box. Add it to your project with:

<script src='https://jalebi.soham.sh/src/themes/themes.js'></script>


This exposes the global jalebi.theme object with these functions:

  • jalebi.theme.setTheme(themeName) - Apply a theme by name
  • jalebi.theme.listThemes() - Get all available themes
  • jalebi.theme.currentTheme() - Get the current theme name
  • jalebi.theme.getTheme(themeName) - Get a specific theme by name
  • jalebi.theme.onReady(callback) - Run code when themes are loaded

Jalebi theme manager also dispatches a theme-updated event when a theme is changed on document.


These are the css variables that are added by the theme manager with its default values for light theme:


:root {
    --bg-1: #ffffff;
    --bg-2: #f7f7f7;
    --bg-3: #e0e0e0;
    --fg-1: #333333;
    --fg-2: #666666;
    --border-1: #cccccc;
    --fg-red: #ff126d;
    --bg-red: #ffebf1;
    --fg-green: #2ecc71;
    --bg-green: #e8f8f1;
    --fg-blue: #487cff;
    --bg-blue: #ebf1ff;
    --fg-yellow: #f1c40f;
    --bg-yellow: #fef9e7;
    --fg-purple: #9b59b6;
    --bg-purple: #f5eef8;
    --fg-cyan: #00bcd4;
    --bg-cyan: #e0f7fa;
    --fg-orange: #e67e22;
    --bg-orange: #fdf2e9;
    --fg-white: #ffffff;
    --bg-white: #ffffff;
    --fg-black: #000000;
    --bg-black: #000000;
    --font: 'Inter', sans-serif;
    --font-cursive: 'Satisfy', cursive;
    --font-heading: 'Inter', sans-serif;
    --font-mono: 'Fira Mono', monospace;
    --radius: 4px;
    --radius-large: 12px;
    --padding-1: 2px;
    --padding-2: 4px;
    --padding-3: 8px;
    --padding-4: 16px;
    --padding-w1: 4px 8px;
    --padding-w2: 8px 16px;
    --padding-w3: 10px 20px;
    --gap-1: 5px;
    --gap-2: 10px;
    --gap-3: 20px;
    --drop-shadow: drop-shadow(0 0 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1));
    --accent-svg: brightness(0) saturate(100%) invert(27%) sepia(51%) saturate(4354%) hue-rotate(242deg) brightness(92%) contrast(93%);
    --fg-accent: #5c35d9;
    --bg-accent: #f2eeff;
    --themed-svg: none;
}

components.name: Marquee
components.description: A simple component for creating scrolling text effects in either direction.

examples.html: Hello, world!This is an infinite marquee.Enjoy scrolling text!

components.code: Hello, world! This is an infinite marquee. Enjoy scrolling text!

components.name: Progress
components.description: Visual indicators for displaying progress, available in both determinate and indeterminate states.

components.name: Spinner
components.description: Loading indicators available in multiple sizes and customizable thickness.
components.code:
<jalebi-spinner size="small"></jalebi-spinner>
<jalebi-spinner size="medium"></jalebi-spinner>
<jalebi-spinner thickness="4" size="large"></jalebi-spinner>

components.name: Input
components.description: Enhanced text input with a floating label and validation-based border colors, supporting text, email, url, tel, and number types.

examples.html: <jalebi-input id="demoInputEmail" type="email" required style="width: 200px" value="user@example.com"><label>Email Address</label></jalebi-input>
<jalebi-input id="demoInputText" type="text" required style="width: 200px" value="John Doe"><label>Full Name</label></jalebi-input>
<jalebi-input id="demoInputTel" type="tel" required style="width: 200px" value="+1-555-555-5555"><label>Phone Number</label></jalebi-input>
<jalebi-input id="demoInputNumber" type="number" pattern="[0-9]{4}" style="width: 200px" value="1234"><label>Four-digit Code</label></jalebi-input>

components.code:
<jalebi-input id="myInput" type="email" required style="width: 200px" value="user@example.com">
  <label>Email Address</label>
</jalebi-input>

components.name: Select
components.description: Enhanced dropdown selectors with search functionality and group support.

examples.html: <jalebi-select id="demoSelect" search style="width: 200px" value="a"><option value="1">Option One</option><option value="2" selected>Option Two</option><optgroup label="Group A"><option value="a">Alpha</option><option value="b">Beta</option></optgroup></jalebi-select>

components.code:
<jalebi-select id="mySelect" search style="width: 200px" value="a">
  <option value="1">Option One</option>
  <option value="2" selected>Option Two</option>
  <optgroup label="Group A">
    <option value="a">Alpha</option>
    <option value="b">Beta</option>
  </optgroup>
</jalebi-select>

components.name: Multiselect
components.description: Enhanced dropdown that allows selecting multiple options with search capabilities.

examples.html: <jalebi-multiselect id="demoMultiselect" search style="width: 200px" value="a, 2"><option value="1">Option One</option><option value="2" selected>Option Two</option><optgroup label="Group A"><option value="a">Alpha</option><option value="b">Beta</option></optgroup></jalebi-multiselect>

components.code:
<jalebi-multiselect id="mySelect" search style="width: 200px" value="a, 2">
  <option value="1">Option One</option>
  <option value="2" selected>Option Two</option>
  <optgroup label="Group A">
    <option value="a">Alpha</option>
    <option value="b">Beta</option>
  </optgroup>
</jalebi-multiselect>

components.name: Toggle
components.description: A switch control for toggling between two states.

components.name: Tags
components.description: Input field that allows users to enter and manage multiple tag values.

examples.html: <jalebi-tags colorful placeholder="Select technologies..." value="javascript,css"><option value="javascript">JavaScript</option><option value="html">HTML</option><option value="css">CSS</option><optgroup label="Frameworks"><option value="react">React</option><option value="vue">Vue</option><option value="angular">Angular</option></optgroup><optgroup label="Backend"><option value="node">Node.js</option><option value="python">Python</option><option value="php">PHP</option></optgroup></jalebi-tags>

components.code:
<jalebi-tags colorful placeholder="Select technologies..." value="javascript,css">
  <option value="javascript">JavaScript</option>
  <option value="html">HTML</option>
  <option value="css">CSS</option>
  <optgroup label="Frameworks">
    <option value="react">React</option>
    <option value="vue">Vue</option>
    <option value="angular">Angular</option>
  </optgroup>
  <optgroup label="Backend">
    <option value="node">Node.js</option>
    <option value="python">Python</option>
    <option value="php">PHP</option>
  </optgroup>
</jalebi-tags>

components.name: DatePicker
components.description: A clean, accessible datepicker component with month navigation and date selection.
components.code: <jalebi-datepicker format="yyyy-mm-dd" placeholder="Select a date" label="Date"></jalebi-datepicker>

components.name: TimePicker
components.description: A 3D carousel-style time picker with intuitive scrolling for hours, minutes, and AM/PM selection.
components.code: <jalebi-timepicker placeholder="Select time" label="Time"></jalebi-timepicker>

components.name: DateTimePicker
components.description: A combined date & time picker component that presents a calendar for date selection and an inline time selector (with optional seconds and 12h/24h formats) in a single dropdown.

examples.html:
<jalebi-datetimepicker
  label="Appointment"
  placeholder="Pick date & time"
  date-format="yyyy-mm-dd"
  time-format="12h"
  show-seconds
></jalebi-datetimepicker>

components.code:
<jalebi-datetimepicker
  label="Date & Time"
  placeholder="Select date & time"
  date-format="yyyy-mm-dd"
  time-format="12h"
  show-seconds
></jalebi-datetimepicker>

components.name: Slider
components.description: A customizable range slider component with support for intervals, steps, and various display options.

examples.html: <jalebi-slider min="1" max="5" value="3" step="1" hide-labels hide-value></jalebi-slider>

components.code:
<jalebi-slider
    min="0"
    max="100"
    value="50"
    step="1"
    interval="10">
</jalebi-slider>

components.name: Checkbox
components.description: A simple customizable checkbox component with optional label on either side.
components.code: <jalebi-checkbox label="Checkbox label" label-position="left"></jalebi-checkbox>

components.name: Radio
components.description: A simple component for creating accessible radio button groups in either horizontal or vertical layouts.

examples.html: <jalebi-radio options="Red, Green, Blue, Yellow" value="Blue" direction="vertical"></jalebi-radio>

components.code:
<jalebi-radio options="Option 1, Option 2, Option 3" value="Option 1" direction="horizontal">
</jalebi-radio>

components.name: Carousel
components.description: An image and content slider with automatic or manual navigation.

components.name: Tooltip
components.description: Provides additional information on hover with customizable positioning.

examples.html: <jalebi-tooltip tooltip="This is the tooltip content!" position="right"><button>Hover me</button></jalebi-tooltip>

components.code:
<jalebi-tooltip tooltip="This is the tooltip content!" position="right">
  <button>Hover me</button>
</jalebi-tooltip>

components.name: Tabs
components.description: A clean and accessible tabs component with support for default and shadcn styling.

examples.html:
This is the content of the first tab.

You can put any HTML content here.

This is the content of the second tab.

Different content appears when this tab is selected.

And here's the content of the third tab.

Each tab can have its own unique content.

Welcome to your dashboard! This is the shadcn style variant.

The tabs have a different look with the shadcn styling.

View your analytics data here.

The shadcn style gives the tabs a cleaner, more modern look.

Adjust your settings and preferences here.

Notice how the active tab has a white background instead of an underline.

components.code:
This is the content of the first tab.

This is the content of the second tab.

This is the content of the third tab.

components.name: Accordion
components.description: Collapsible content panels for organizing information in a limited space.

examples.html:
This is the content for section 1.

Content for section 2 goes here.

You can add any HTML content inside.

This is section 3 content.

components.code:
Jalebi is a collection of lightweight, customizable web components that can be easily integrated into any web project. The components are built with vanilla JavaScript and have no external dependencies.

You can include Jalebi directly from a CDN or download the source files:

<script src="https://cdn.example.com/jalebi.min.js"></script>

Or use npm:

npm install jalebi-components

Yes! Jalebi uses CSS variables that can be easily overridden to match your project's design system. This makes it simple to customize colors, fonts, spacing, and more.

For example:

:root { --fg-accent: #ff5500; --bg-accent: #fff1e6; }

components.name: Breadcrumbs
components.description: Navigation aid that shows the user's location in a website hierarchy.
components.code:
<jalebi-breadcrumbs data-breadcrumb="Home:/,Products:/p,Shoes:/p/shoes,Sneakers:/p/shoes/sneakers" type="slash"></jalebi-breadcrumbs>

<jalebi-breadcrumbs 
  data-breadcrumb="Home:/,Products:/products,Electronics:/products/electronics,Smartphones:/products/electronics/smartphones,iPhone:/products/electronics/smartphones/iphone" 
  type="arrow" 
  max-elements="3">
</jalebi-breadcrumbs>

components.name: Dialog
components.description: Modal dialogs for displaying important information or capturing user input.

examples.html:
Dialog Content

This is a draggable dialog that works as both a modal dialog on desktop and a bottom sheet on mobile.

Try resizing your browser window to see how it adapts!

On mobile or narrow screens, you can:

  • Drag down to dismiss
  • Drag up to expand

My Dialog Title

Custom Header Content

This is a draggable dialog with a custom header.

You can customize the header as per your design requirements.
